msDesc.head: Unpublished fragments of charred papyrus rolls from Tanis.

msContents.summary: Hieratic and hieroglyphic fragments (the latter possibly belonging with MSS. Egypt. a. 5-8 (P), including fragments of the "Geographical Papyrus.
msContents.textLang: Egyptian in Hieratic and hieroglyphic script

msItem.note: Entries of nomes, feasts, marshlands and other geaographical sites, often corrected by notes in minute Hieratic at the foot of the document, fragments of a document with columns of hieroglyphic text, in which the gods grant divine gifts to a king or emperor, whose cartouche is unfortunately left blank. The documents may preserve sketches and notes to be expanded on some temple-wall at Tanis.

65 fragments of this same lot are now at the British Museum and were published by William Flinders Petrieas the Geographical PpayrusGriffith, Francis Llewellyn, and W. M. Flinders Petrie. Two Hieroglyphic Papyri from Tanis. I. The Sign Papyrus, a Syllabary, II. The Geographical Papyrus, an Almanack, (London: N.p., 1889), pp. 21-25.

supportDesc.extent: 34 fragments of burnt papyrus. The measurement given is for the largest fragment only. 147 63

layoutDesc.layout: A section of hieratic text and a section of cursive hieroglyphs. The number of columns and lines is almost impossible to determine due to the burnt and fragmented nature of the papyrus.

handDesc.handNote: Likely written by one scribe, all in black ink.

history.provenance: Excavated at Tanisby William Flinders Petriein spring 1884.
Brought to England and conserved at the British Museum in 1885
history.acquisition: Given by the Egypt Exploration Fund, June 1918

recordHist.source: Summary description abbreviated from the Bodleian Libraries' unpublished card catalogue for otherwise-undescribed manuscripts, available in the Charles Wendell David Reading Room. Griffith, Francis Llewellyn, and W. M. Flinders Petrie. Two Hieroglyphic Papyri from Tanis. I. The Sign Papyrus, a Syllabary, II. The Geographical Papyrus, an Almanack, (London: N.p., 1889), pp. 1-3.

availability.p: This item may only be consulted by prior arrangement with a curator. To make an application, please click the request button above. When your request is received, you will be asked to contact the relevant person.
